div.p: The hihghlighted part of the text will eb something about M's support of the recommendation of the Government Printer

div.p: As an aside, the paper was certainly not cheap at around 20p per sheet, roughly £8.30 in 2021 money
VPRS 1211/PO000/16, outward correspondence p. 1665-6, VA 865 Department of the Treasurer, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof. p/cs by TD. *** need to get a clearer copy of the first page.
22 Nov [18]77
editorial addition.

Adverting to your memorandum to the Chief Secretary of the 22nd August
M to W. Odgers, 22 August 1877 (in this edition as 77-08-02a). last, in which [you …] the receipt of the […] that twenty five reams
MS annotation: '£1,000'. of Lithographic paper be ordered in England for the illustrative plates of the Eucalyptus Atlas. I have the honor to inform you that the Agent General has been instructed to procure the papers required.

I have to request that an account in favor of the Receiver and Paymaster, Melbourne, for this estimated cost of the order under notice may be forwarded to this office in time to admit of the amount being remitted to the Agent General by the Mail

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
